alert.note: Alert for Montgomery (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 06 at 1:57AM CDT until April 09 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected, particularly in the vicinity of Interstate 45. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following counties, Montgomery and Walker. * WHEN...Until 500 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas, particularly in the vicinity of Interstate 45 from Willis to New Waverly. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 157 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area in the next hour or so. This additional rain will result in minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage locations. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Willis and New Waverly. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
